metadata.Title: CVE-2014-3167 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Multiple unspecified vulnerabilities in Google Chrome before 36.0.1985.143 allow attackers to cause a denial of service or possibly have other impact via unknown vectors.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3167` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 37.0.2062.94-0ubuntu0.14.04.1~pkg1042
chromium-browser-l10n - 37.0.2062.94-0ubuntu0.14.04.1~pkg1042
chromium-chromedriver - 37.0.2062.94-0ubuntu0.14.04.1~pkg1042
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 37.0.2062.94-0ubuntu0.14.04.1~pkg1042
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 37.0.2062.94-0ubuntu0.14.04.1~pkg1042
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.0.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.0.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqmlscene - 1.0.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.0.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.0.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '37.0.2062.94-0ubuntu0.14.04.1~pkg1042').
oxide-qt package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
